How the mendicants develop mindfulness o: If I’d only live for another day and night
If I’d only live for another day
If I’d only live as long as it takes to eat a meal of almsfood
If I’d only live as long as it takes to chew and swallow four or five mouthfuls
If I’d only live as long as it takes to chew and swallow a single mouthful
If I’d only live as long as it takes to breathe out after breathing in, or to breathe in after breathing out
The two types of mendicants who develop: Mendicants who develop mindfulness of death by wishing to live for a day and night, or to live for a day, or to live as long as it takes to eat a meal of almsfood, or to live as long as it takes to chew and swallow four or five mouthfuls

Mendicants who develop mindfulness of death by wishing to live as long as it takes to chew and swallow a single mouthful, or to live as long as it takes to breathe out after breathing in, or to breathe in after breathing out
The training that should be followed (a: Keenly develop mindfulness of death for the ending of defilements.
